image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor press conference

props.synopsis: The budget bottom line would be worse in the first two years of a Dutton Coalition government than under Labor, the party's costings have revealed.

title.children: Breaking: Coalition costings reveal worse budget for first two years under Dutton compared to Labor

image.altText: Jane Hume stands at lectern

props.synopsis: The Coalition is releasing its costings in the final days of the campaign. It's claiming budget deficits will be $10 billion less than under Labor.

title.children: Coalition's public service cuts 'focused on Canberra', shadow finance minister says

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coalition to cut foreign aid by $814 million over four years
Vaping would be regulated, taxed under a future Dutton government, Taylor says
Migration cuts will cost the budget about $4.2 billion, Taylor admits

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: The Coalition has revealed its costings and Labor is feeling optimistic about key seats in Melbourne as election night edges closer.

title.children: Coalition's curriculum confusion, Albanese 'nervous' as polling day nears

image.altText: Simon Patterson walks through a sunlit carpark, dressed in a black suit and blue tie.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court trial of Victorian woman Erin Patterson, who is accused of using a poisoned meal to murder three relatives, continues. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Erin Patterson tried to persuade ex to attend fatal lunch, court hears

image.altText: Steven Mao and Jessica Yuan anding out how-to-vote cards wearing Monique Ryan shirts.

props.synopsis: The head of a Chinese community group that helped organise volunteers for two candidates has furiously denied he is trying to help China's government influence the federal election.

title.children: Group that organised election volunteers denies links to Beijing

image.altText: Jacinta Price speaks while Dutton stands behind her listening.

props.synopsis: Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price asserts Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is "absolutely" committed to ending "indoctrination" in schools by teachers, just hours after Mr Dutton said the Coalition had no proposal to change the curriculum.

title.children: Nampijinpa Price contradicts Dutton, asserting Coalition will end school 'indoctrination'

image.altText: Peter Dutton election shadows

props.synopsis: A YouGov poll suggests Labor's momentum over the Coalition has firmed, with a two-party preferred vote approaching 53 per cent.

title.children: Dutton hints at campaign failure as polls show Albanese majority in sight

image.altText: Donald Trump's face shown close up while he frowns and looks to his right

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has continued to spruik his government's economic record, hours after a government report showed the US economy had contracted for the first time in three years.

title.children: Trump signals 'tariff wall' for big pharma after US economy shrinks

image.altText: a woman holding a tray of cookies

props.synopsis: The ABC understands the ambassadorship was a "small value one" that came in at under $10,000. Only half had been paid.

title.children: Brooke Bellamy dropped as ambassador after recipe plagiarism claims

image.altText: Close up shot of arms holding a small child, whose bare leg and foot are visible.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane couple could face prosecution after they admitted to using a commercial surrogacy service to have a baby abroad, but experts say the laws need to change.

title.children: Couple who used overseas surrogate to have baby could face prosecution

image.altText: A black farmed mobile phone featuring a Meta logo in front of blurred social media platform logos

props.synopsis: Technology giants are on the rise in extended trade, following a volatile day on Wall Street as data revealed the US economy contracted. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Upbeat earnings from Meta and Microsoft boost market mood

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tesla says reports of search for Musk's successor false
ASX climbs through session to close higher
Donald Trump calls for interest rate cuts as US economy contracts

image.altText: A view of the Jerusalem skyline shrouded in smoke.

props.synopsis: Dry and windy conditions fanned the flames, forcing motorists on the main highway between Jerusalem and Tel Aviv to abandon their cars and run for their lives.

title.children: Israel calls for international help as wildfires erupt near Jerusalem

image.altText: A construction worker on a house roof

props.synopsis: The government made a series of industrial relations reforms during its first term, from multi-employer bargaining to enshrining a right for workers to disconnect. Here's a reminder of what changed.

title.children: Before the WFH backflip, industrial relations was already on the political agenda

image.altText: Bang amd his mother were sitting in the sofa chair playing with Duo Duo on the coffee table.

props.synopsis: I remember my first vote in China — three candidates, three ballot boxes and voting slips. There was just one thing missing and in Australia, it's everywhere.

title.children: I traded my Chinese passport for the right to cast one free vote

image.altText: Greens candidate Mandy Nolan and nurses

props.synopsis: Tensions are high in the northern NSW seat of Richmond, where nurses desperate for better pay who are handing out Greens flyers say they are under pressure from their former allies.

title.children: Fed-up nurses campaigning for Greens allege pre-poll bullying by Labor

image.altText: Scott Bessent and Yulia Svyrydenko sign papers at a desk in front of US and Ukrainian flags.

props.synopsis: The US and Ukraine sign an agreement to create a "reconstruction investment fund", two months after initial plans to sign a wartime deal were shelved when the countries' leaders spectacularly clashed in the Oval Office.

title.children: US, Ukraine sign resources deal two months after Oval Office clash

image.altText: An Indian border guard raises his hand in a gesture indicating stop to a car with two women in the back.

props.synopsis: Following a deadly militant attack, Pakistan and India have hit each other with a range of tough measures including cancelling visas, which has left families separated and wondering when they will be able to reunite.

title.children: 'We shouldn't have come': The families stranded at the Indian border

image.altText: A generic graphic image including a gold dollar sign and some websites.

props.synopsis: Cybercriminals have stolen and shared almost 100 staff logins for Australia's Big Four banks, putting those businesses at a higher risk of mass data theft and ransomware attacks, cyber security researchers say.

title.children: Stolen bank staff logins could be an 'open gate' for hackers, experts say

image.altText: Colourful painting of man on horse with moutains in background and coloured butterflies overhead.

props.synopsis: Abdul Abdullah has won the $3,000 Packing Room Prize at this year's Archibald Prize for his portrait of Jason Phu.

title.children: Portrait of Jason Phu wins Packing Room Prize in 104th year of the Archibald Prize

image.altText: Aerial view of southern right whale cow-calf pairs.

props.synopsis: The southern right whale species had the unfortunate habit of going close to shore, making them easy pickings for whalers. After the practice was banned, their population bounced back — but researchers say something disturbing is happening to their numbers.

title.children: Something is happening with the southern right whale population, scientists say

image.altText: a big wave of white water smashes over a road in the midst of a storm

props.synopsis: The severe low pressure system has prompted a rare red weather warning to be issued for New Zealand's capital.

title.children: Wild winds prompt 'threat to life' warnings in Wellington

image.altText: a white skyscrapper with rio tinto

props.synopsis: A delegation of Pilbara traditional owners has accused Rio Tinto of not giving investors the full story about the environmental and social impacts of its WA mines.

title.children: Rio Tinto executives lashed by traditional owners at AGM

image.altText: A moody photo of Trisha Blake standing with a serious expression in an office.

props.synopsis: With the state government set to start offering rebates for home batteries on July 1, consumer protection authorities have warned to be wary of scams.

title.children: Scam texts warning as anticipation builds for home battery rebates

image.altText: woman holding phone close up

props.synopsis: Rage bait can range from the banal to the extreme, and leave us feeling overwhelmed and isolated. Here's how to spot it, and avoid feeding the beast.

title.children: Social media making you angry? You could be falling for rage bait

image.altText: A graphic of parliament house surrounded by cards depicting different electorates

props.synopsis: A former journalist, a comedian and the man who used to be a Nationals pick — here are the candidates and seats that may land a surprise this Saturday.

title.children: The wildcard seats to keep an eye on this election

image.altText: green how to vote cards in the background with a text box that says enter your suburb

props.synopsis: The full set of major party players' how-to-vote guides for the House of Representatives reveals some surprising alliances.

title.children: The strange 'ballot-fellows' revealed on parties' how-to-vote cards

image.altText: lady ute

props.synopsis: Indigenous voters around the country could, mathematically at least, decide some of Australia’s closest seats this election.

title.children: 'Sleeping power': The untapped voters that could help decide key seats

image.altText: Flooded street in outback town

props.synopsis: After an unprecedented disaster season in Queensland, climate action is not on the minds of many voters in some of the hardest-hit regions this federal election.

title.children: Climate action not swaying regional voters, despite year of disasters

image.altText: A man in religious dress, with his hands pressed together in prayer.

props.synopsis: As dean of the College of Cardinals, this is supposed to be Giovanni Battista Re's moment. There's just one problem: the 91-year-old won't be in the Sistine Chapel when voting for a new pope begins next week.

title.children: This conclave, some of the most influential cardinals won't even be inside

image.altText: King Charles waving with a smile as he leaves a church service.

props.synopsis: It is the most candid the King has been about his health challenges since being diagnosed in February 2024.

title.children: King Charles opens up about 'frightening' and 'daunting' cancer experience

image.altText: Mark Carney grinning and raising the palms of both hands while standing in front of a blurred Canadian flag and wearing a suit

props.synopsis: The newly-elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit the White House within a week in the hope of securing a fresh trade deal, according to US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Canadian PM will visit White House to sign new trade deal, Trump says

image.altText: Becky Lucas, a woman in her 30s, stands smiling on stage, holding a microphone in her hand, and wearing a floral blouse.

props.synopsis: Becky Lucas, Luke McGregor and Jen Carnovale are comedians returning with their first shows since becoming parents. How has parenthood shaped them and their jokes?

title.children: The comedians bringing their babies on tour — and talking parenthood on stage
